poem:
Title: "The Thirst of Panama"

No rain on Panama's cheek,
In the Canal's furrow, heat seeks.
Mulino, the promise that looms,
Within chambers of justices' rooms. 

Echoes of strife kettledrum the air,
A nation's heart, brittle with care.
Under the sun, democracy being wrought,
In the crucible of unrest and drought. 

Shadows of ballots cast, profound,
Over the precincts of parched ground.
